h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61788].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Due to JIRA not being able to handle 4 byte characters when using MySQL (JRA-36135), emails which contains 4 byte characters will fail to be created. However JIRA keeps on trying to process the email and each time it does, {{issuenum}} will increase by 1 although a ticket is never really created

h3. Suggestion
Avoid this from happening. Some suggestions are
# Either stop processing kind of mail the moment it fails once to avoid issue number from increasing OR
# Change the process such that it will only increment {{issuenum}} when an issue is successfully created
fields.summary: Issue Number increasing randomly

When using a WebHook created with a invalid URL, e.g. {{http://thisurldoesnotexists}}, no errors/exceptions will be thrown on the application logs ({{catalina.out}}, {{atlassian-jira.log}}) when performing the event that triggers the listener, unlike when a 404 or 500 is returned from the server.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61773].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 

The default priority icons on new projects are not accessible for red-green colour blind users.

The icons used for priority are green, orange and red, with no shape to distinguish them for a colour blind user.
The "medium", "high" and "highest" icons look the same to me from a normal viewing distance, and I need to get close to the screen to tell them apart (I'm colour deficient, the 12% of all men type). 

The "low" and "lowest" icons look the same colour, but they are at least pointing down.

On other types of projects, they have either a double arrow head, or a dotted "stem" so that the colour is not the only indication of priority.

h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Business ==> Project Management type project. (or a Software project)
2. Create a "Task" issue.
3. Notice the priority icon and the available options for it by clicking on the field in the view issue page.

h3. Expected Results.

It's possible to distinguish all priority options without relying on their colour as an indication.

h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to distinguish all priority options without relying on their colour as an indication.

h3. Workaround

Configure a different set of icons for each new project affected by this bug.
fields.summary: Priority icons on new projects are not accessible for red-green colour blind users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61772].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
API endpoint {{rest/api/2/user}} does not allow searching by email address, only username.

My test user is an admin with Global Permission "Browse Users". I have tested directly with {{curl}}, a web browser, and the {{jira-ruby}} gem.

The documentation says finding by email address should work:

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-findUsers

h2. Environment
Latest JIRA Cloud

h2. Steps to Reproduce
1. Using a user with Global Permission "Browse Users"
2. Query by username {{https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=fred}}
3. Query by email address {{https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?username=fred%40example.com}}

h2. Expected Results
Both queries should return the same user object.

h2. Actual Results
The first query works, the second query returns an error:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["The user named 'fred@example.com' does not exist"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h2. Workaround
None

h2. Similar Reports
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/243603/jira-rest-api-find-jira-user-based-on-users-email-address
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/174117/restapi2usersearch-not-returning-user
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60328
fields.summary: Unable to query REST API for user by email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61754].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you try to search a word which contains a forward slash with a wildcard, Lucene is not able to find that word.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with description = "RD/EE"
# Use the following JQL to search for that issue will work: {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/EE"{color}}} 
# If now change to use a JQL with a wildcard {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E?"{color}}} or {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E*"{color}}}, the issue is not found.

h3. Expected Results
Issue is in the result set of the JQL {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E?"{color}}} or {{{color:#59afe1}description ~ "RD/E*"{color}}}

h3. Actual Results
Issue not found
 
h3. Notes
As suggested in [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-ReservedCharacters] I've used double back slash to escape the forward slash, but JQL {noformat}description ~ "RD\\/E?"{noformat} is still not working

h3.Workaround
Replace forward slash with a white space seems to work
fields.summary: Forward slash + wildcard causes JQL incorrect search result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61753].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , for Application Link , user only can send *GET* and *DELETE* request . But , *POST* is not available to create application link.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide *POST* function for creating Application Link

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use the unofficial endpoint discussed in the following thread in the [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/] (it works for both, Server and Cloud): [Jira cloud addon: use API to create oauth1 application link|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Jira-cloud-addon-use-API-to-create-oauth1-application-link/qaq-p/1134043#M50814]


- *Endpoint:* 
{noformat}
https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlinkForm/createAppLink
{noformat}


 
- *Request Body:* 
{noformat}
{
"applicationLink": {
"typeId": "generic",
"name": "myapp",
"displayUrl": "http://example.com",
"rpcUrl": "http://example.com",
"isPrimary": false,
"isSystem": true
},
"username": "admin",
"password": "admin",
"customRpcURL": false,
"rpcUrl": "",
"createTwoWayLink": false,
"configFormValues": {
"trustEachOther": false,
"shareUserbase": false
}
}
{noformat}
 

- *Response Body:*
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<createdApplicationLink>
<applicationLink>
<link href="https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/applinks/latest/applicationlink/a9b9f043-36ce-3181-a08e-774e01113b31" rel="self"/>
<id>a9b9f043-36ce-3181-a08e-774e01113b31</id>
<typeId>generic</typeId>
<name>myapp</name>
<displayUrl>http://example.com</displayUrl>
<iconUrl>https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/s/-w84psc/b/11/14089203f537b6cb29f73c5809f577b4a6a0c922/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/types/16generic.png</iconUrl>
<iconUri>https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/s/-w84psc/b/11/14089203f537b6cb29f73c5809f577b4a6a0c922/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.applinks.applinks-plugin:applinks-images/images/config/logos/128x128/128generic.png</iconUri>
<rpcUrl>http://example.com</rpcUrl>
<isPrimary>false</isPrimary>
<isSystem>false</isSystem>
</applicationLink>
<autoConfigurationSuccessful>true</autoConfigurationSuccessful>
</createdApplicationLink>
{noformat}
 

Please notice that this is just a workaround: the endpoint is not officially documented and it may change without prior notice. Please review the thread for further details.
fields.summary: REST API to Create Application Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61746].
  {panel}

h2. Overview

Simply put, the Fix Versions field is contentious and sought after, specifically on a Scrum Board as a third tier hierarchy for things like:

- Good packaging and release management (ever accelerating with CI)
- Tracking the release of an overall product
- Tracking the progress of a milestone
- Tracking a mega-epic
- Tracking related work between two teams in the same project when their epics might be too focused

The Version Report in the Scrum Board is simply too good to only have teams make logical groupings of code releases with, especially as releases happen in smaller and smaller chunks as teams migrate to CI.

It is known that an issue can have multiple fix versions, but the Scrum Boards do not support this well (single version enforcement on drag and drop) and the push to use these strategically is doubling up on the desired usage of this field.

I run into this conflict over and over! It's such a useful field, and I'm hoping to have more ways to extend the grouping and reporting without that conflict.

h2. My Request (happy to chat about it):

- Please keep fix versions as the are today, with reporting intact.
- Introduce a new field (perhaps "Milestones") with similar:
-- Interactions on the Scrum Board (drag and drop)
-- Parameters for Start / End Dates
-- Reporting similar to that of fix versions
- Option on the Scrum Board to either show Fix Versions or Milestones as the primary drag and drop bucket (labs?).  The other would just be an editable field per issue, to not bloat the interface.
fields.summary: Segment Fix Versions from Strategic Objectives on Scrum Boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61743].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When changing a issue's issue type, the current way is to perform a *Move* operation, which as per documentation on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Moving+an+issue, the *Create Issue* permission is needed on the target project to complete this action. However, this also applies to issues that are not being moved from one project to another, where only the issue type is being changed but not the project.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the need that the user must have the *Create Issue* permission when using the *Move* action to simply change the issue type, but keeping the issue on the exact same project.
fields.summary: Allow user to change issue type without Create Issue permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61736].
  {panel}

Suggested:
The Workflow Designer in Jira 6 and 7 could benefit greatly from a toggle-able grid. Recomended spacing would be equal to half the height of a status label. This would then work with the existing snapping to the top, bottom, and center of other status labels.

Issue:
Currently, the centers or sides of statuses will snap to the center or sides other existing statuses (and display the relevant guide) for the sake of lining them up in straight lines. However there's nothing to help with spacing. This, together with the fact that you can't move the transition lines or labels (JRA-35712) adds a lot of time to the Workflow design process in order to make a complex workflow neat and clear.

To Reproduce the issue:
To reproduce the issue and demonstrate the need for a grid, grab any status label in the workflow designer and move it in any direction AWAY from other status labels. There are no guides to help ensure that spacing is clear or equidistant from other status labels, only guides that show whether a status label is in line with other status labels.
fields.summary: Give the Workflow Designer a toggle-able Grid.

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA issue linking with issues from another JIRA instance (from Application link) can only be done from the existing issue (Issue page -> More -> Link Issue).

During issue creation it's possible to add issue linking as well but it's restricted to the issues in the same JIRA instance where the issue is being created.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA to link issue from other JIRA instance during issue creation (using Application link).

h3. Workaround 

If user would like to link issue, they have to create the issue first and then link it to another issue from the issue page.
fields.summary: JIRA Link Issue from other instance during issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61726].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an *admin* the user could *import issue links* by going to *External System Import*, then configuring the issue links in the "Map Fields" screen of the Issue Import Wizard, under Links & Sub-Tasks, as shown in the image below:
 !issuelinkbiggest.png|thumbnail! 

But as a *non-admin*, the user is *unable* to access the *administration* panel. Consequently, the non-admin user will be unable to import issue links. In order for non-admin users to import issues from CSV, the user must go to
*issues* > *Import issues from CSV*, as shown in the image below:
 !importissuesfromcsv.png|thumbnail! 

However, if the CSV file contains issue links, the user will not be able to configure this in the "Map Fields" screen of the Issue Import Wizard, under *Links & Sub-Tasks* as it only contains Issue Id and Parent Id, as shown in the image below:
 !issuelinknotavailablebig.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Mentioned in the following KB:
[How to Import Issue Links from a CSV File as a non-admin user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Import+Issue+Links+from+a+CSV+File+as+a+non-admin+user]


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the *non-admin* user with the ability to link issues through the "Map Fields" screen of the *Issue Import Wizard*.
fields.summary: Ability to Import Issue Links from a CSV File as a non-admin user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61714].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Since JIRA 7 it's no longer possible to have custom CSS/JS for a custom field within a JIRA "Filter Results" gadget that is used in confluence.

* jira-gadgets-plugin-6.4.2/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml
{code}
<![CDATA[
        #requireContext("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete")
        #requireContext("jira.webresources:issue-table")
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:g-filter-results")
        #includeResources()

        <script type="text/javascript">
{code}

* jira-gadgets-plugin-7.0.5/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml
{code}
<![CDATA[
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete")
        #requireResource("jira.webresources:issue-table")
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:g-filter-results")
        #includeResources()

        <script type="text/javascript">
{code}

According to https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRASERVER/repos/jira/commits/2ec9538e19dda08a44ac82dd20c7c05e4da363e2#jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml, the reason the change was implemented was because the gadget requires web-resources correctly from opensocial and none of it were contexts but resources and it shouldn't have worked.

However since the gadget is no longer using any contexts, it's no longer possible to inject Resources into this gadget

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an existing or new context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61710].
  {panel}

Using IE11, from the "Manage Filters" or "Manage Dashboards" screen, when I click the "Edit" link to share my filter or dashboard, the dialog that comes up does not show existing "Shared with" groups or projects.
If we add on new "Shared With" groups or project from this dialog, the existing settings get overwritten.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a filter or dashboard.
# Click on "Edit" from  "Manage Filters" or "Manage Dashboards"  screen to share with a group or project.
# After update, verify that share group or project appears in the "Shared With" column for the filter or dashboard.
# Click on the "Edit" link again for the same filter or dashboard. The edit dialog does not show the existing "Shared with" groups or project.

Tested that problem exists on IE11, but works fine on Chrome 42.

*Workaround for IE11:*
Right-click on "Edit" link, and choose open in new tab or window. The existing "Shared With" groups or projects will show then.
fields.summary: Manage Filters/Dashboards "Edit" option does not show existing "Shared With" on IE

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61706].
  {panel}

When navigating sub-tasks and their parents using the links in the tickets, the browser history is no longer recording each page visit and the back button does not work as expected.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# View an issue with sub-tasks
# Right click a sub-task and open the link in a new tab
# In the new tab, click the link to the parent ticket
# Verify the parent ticket is displayed

*Expected Results:*
Clicking the back button takes me to the sub-task I just opened in the new tab.

*Actual Results:*
The back button is disabled b/c the browser doesn't know a different URL has been visited.

*NOTES:*

* This occurs in both FireFox and Chrome.
* This occurs even if you don't open a link in a new tab, it's just the simplest way to reproduce the issue.
* This started occurring last week
* I haven't validated other links not working correctly, but I've noticed the issue quite a lot.

*Workaround*
In the meantime, users can open links/subtasks/pages in a new tab.
fields.summary: Navigating back to a subtask from a parent issue is not possible via browser history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61704].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Slow execution of _Project_ - _Fields_ are caused by large number configuration items (custom-fields) present in the view. JIRA inefficiently computes number of related screens and doesn't cache some custom-fields data to optimize the performance.

h3. Environment
 Large JIRA instance 
* with many custom-fields (1000+)
* with many fieldlayouts items:
{code:java}
SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayout; 
556 

SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayoutitem; 
1355666

SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayoutscheme;  
477
{code}
* with many screens
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select count(1) from fieldscreen;
  1322

select count(1) from fieldscreentab;
  1803
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create large JIRA instance 
 # Open Project configuration screen
 # Go to Fields _Scheme_ (<JIRA>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PRG>/fields)

h3. Expected Results
Initial load time is low (< 30 seconds) time and second execution is fast (< 10 seconds).

h3. Actual Results
Call takes 80-90 seconds, second call still slow.

h3. Notes
From SQL log you can see a lot of calls to DB. Total number of executed SQLs *11850*:
{code:java}
// Break down by table
awk -F'(FROM|WHERE)' '/SELECT/{print $2}' http-bio-8443-exec-11_sql | sort | uniq -c | sort -k1,1 -n

 363  fieldlayoutschemeentity
 393  fieldlayout
 393  fieldlayoutitem
 504  nodeassociation
 853  fieldlayoutscheme
1121  fieldscreen
1121  fieldscreentab
1318  propertyentry
1541  fieldscreenlayoutitem
4240  managedconfigurationitem
{code}

Second call still does a lot of SQL call to {{managedconfigurationitem}} table, this data is not cashed:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
grep 'http-bio-8080-exec-8' atlassian-jira-sql.log.3 | awk -F'(FROM|WHERE)' '/SELECT/{print $2}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -k1,1 -n
   1  public.fieldlayoutscheme ORDER BY NAME ASC"
   1  public.userhistoryitem
   2  public.propertyentry
   5  public.kpluginscfg
4466  public.managedconfigurationitem
{code}

h5. Profile data
 !JRA_61704_jps_stack.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
This is performance problem in JIRA. You can lower the impact by reducing the number of items (custom-fields) for _Field Configuration_ for project, to do that, please _Hide_ the field.
fields.summary: Slow loading of Project - Fields screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61696].
  {panel}

In jira cloud, Issue links currently take too much visual space and have bright colors which make them the only thing we can see.
For instance in the attached image, the link is useful as a straight url, but showing bright colors plus resolved status is actually harmful.
I just never care for the status. Having the link barred would be much terser and not attract the reader's attention on useless details.
In addition, the status being shown, "complete", is not the status of the issue, which is "closed". So it's an unfamiliar term that shows and only confuses the reader.

Suggestion:
1/ Get back to a strikethrough, remove the icon, and keep an underlined/url link aspect.
2/ Alternately, use softer colors, remove the icon, and be consistent and show the status 'in may case "closed") instead of "complete"/"open"/... which is not something users can relate to as it's not the status they manipulate.
fields.summary: Issue links should not take as much space in comments/description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61680].
  {panel}

h4. PROBLEM:

{quote}
If an email message contains an issue key in its subject line and that issue key exists in your JIRA installation, the handler will add the email message content as a comment on the issue, regardless of which project the issue is in.
{quote}

The above quoted information doesn't seem to be working as expected. When adding a comment to an issue key from other project within JIRA, it doesn't seem to add a comment despite specifying the issue key on the subject line but rather creating a new issue on the project defined in the mail handler configuration with the issue key as the issue summary. 

h4. STEPS to REPRODUCE

# Create a mail handler and select "Create a new issue from each email message"
# Send an email to the mailbox with an existing issue key (from a different project) within JIRA and a random email body

h4. EXPECTED RESULT
- From this [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-802592933.html], it is supposed to add a comment to an existing issue key within JIRA regardless of which project the issue is in.

h4. ACTUAL RESULT
- It created a new issue on the project defined in the mail handler configuration. Having the issue key as the summary. 


h4. ENVIRONMENT
- JIRA 6.4.12 and JIRA 7.1.8
fields.summary: "Create a new issue from each email message" mail handler is not adding a comment to an existing issue

h3. Summary
When users try to set up a release version, they can't only choose some months. When the month has been shortened using a dot at the end, it doesn't work. In other parts of the product, like for example Due date on JIRA software this problem doesn't exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into an instance and change default language to French.
# Change your profile to French.
# Navigate to *Cog icon > Projects > choose project > Versions*.
# Try adding a date. If the month has been abbreviated using a dot (.) at the end, the system will return the error  "Please enter the date in the following format: d/MMM/yy"
 
h3. Expected Results
You can select any date.

h3. Actual Results
If the month has been abbreviated using a dot (.) at the end, the system will return the error  "Please enter the date in the following format: d/MMM/yy"
 
h3. Notes
The abbreviations are currently displayed as follows:
"janv.",
"févr.",
"mars",
"avr.",
"mai",
"juin",
"juil.",
"août",
"sept.",
"oct.",
"nov.",
"déc."

h3.Workaround
Change the profile language to English, you'll be able to enter any date (will be displayed in English).
fields.summary: Date picker doesn't work correctly in French

h3. Description
In the 6.4 JIRA version, dwg file was uploaded as attachment and will automatically download when user clicks on it. 

While In JIRA 7.1.7 version, the dwg file type was treated as image file and allows you to preview it. When users click the dwg attachment in JIRA issue, it will prompt error message stating fail to load. Users will need to right clicks on the attachment and open in a new tab to download the file.

h3. Expected Bahavior
In JIRA 6.4.9, the dwg file should be automatically downloaded when user click it.

In JIRA 7.1.7, the dwg file was expected to automatically download when user click it or successfully preview the file when user click it.

h3. Actual Result
In JIRA 6.4
 !image-2016-06-24-15-36-57-721.png|thumbnail! 

In JIRA 7.1.2
 !image-2016-06-24-15-26-40-425.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a ticket in JIRA 7.1.7 version
# Upload a dwg file type attachement
# Click on the attachement
# JIRA will show error message file fail to load.

h3. Workaround
Users will need to right clicks on the attachment and open in a new tab to download the file.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior in opening dwg file in JIRA 6.4 and JIRA 7.1.2

h3. Problem Definition
When creating a sub-task, the change is not reflected in the parent issue's "updated date" nor is displayed in the parent issue's activity tab. This can pose a problem to auditing teams who need to report on the issue changes.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The [Adding the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/adding-the-two-dimensional-filter-statistics-gadget-588581647.html] this does a great job on configuration. However its missing a very critical piece of information.

Currently we only specify this as far as field behavior regarding the gadget:
- If choosing a custom field, please note that the following types of custom fields are supported by this gadget out-of-the-box: 'Group picker', 'Multi select', 'User picker', 'Select list' and 'Version picker'.
- What fields should/are selectable for the gadget and what the logic is in what is selectable.

From what I tell it applies all fields that is supports on the instance regardless of wether its relevant to the filter. The field itself needs to be "statable" that is to say fields the fields must be "fixed length lists" for system fields. However there a number feature request that should be documented in the documentation link such as: 

- [JRA-35903|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35903] *Two dimensional filter gadget should include estimate fields*
- [JRA-37964|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37964] - *Add the custom field type "Text Field" for the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget*
- [JRA-41573|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41573] *'Raised in Versions' field selection to 'Affects Version/s' in Two Dimensional Filter*
- [JRA-36720|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36720] *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget should allow sorting of values as configured in select list custom field*
- [JSW-10424|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-10424] *Allow gadgets to show statistics using story points instead of issue counts*
- [JRA-40193|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40193] *Add the custom field type "Date Field" for the two dimensional filter statistics gadget*


h3. Suggested Solution
 Document more detail on what fields are selectable and provide more detail on limitations based on statistical data or current feature request.
fields.summary: More thorough documentation on functionality: "Adding the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget"

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61642].
  {panel}

When navigating amongst related links in a JIRA issue, the web browser's page history is screwed up, interfering with the user's ability to navigate.

STR:

1. visit a web site (e.g., http://www.atlassian.com).
2. visit a JIRA issue with related issues by loading a bookmark or typing in its URL (e.g., https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1579).
3. click on a linked issue in the latter page (e.g., “is related to: SRCTREE-3286” link in the preceding example).
4. click the browser's Back button.

Expected: browser is returned to the previous page (SRCTREE-1579 in this example).

Actual: browser skips over the referring page (loads www.atlassian.com in this example).

Reproduced with Safari 9.1.1 (11601.6.17) and Firefox 47.0 in hosted version of JIRA 1000.98.4. (The “affects versions” field does not offer this version, so I indicated 1000.98.3 instead.)
fields.summary: Navigating to another issue breaks the browser history stack

  {panel}

At least once a month, as a JIRA system admin, I get an email bounced back to me from the account used to send the notifications from JIRA because some project level admin clicked the email address link listed at the top of the notification scheme page thinking that's what they were supposed to do to get help changing their notification scheme.

I can see why they do that. And it's annoying because unless i'm looking at every bounceback message from that account (we don't have it turned on to create issues from emails) I will miss some.

I'd love for it to say something like "Notification emails currently being sent from:" instead of just "Email:".

 !image-2016-06-23-13-24-49-185.png|thumbnail!

The JIRA documentation for [Generating a thread dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Generating+a+thread+dump] is missing several important details that are noted on the Confluence doc [Generating a Thread Dump Externally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump+Externally].

Missing pieces in JIRA doc:
- The note to 'Take Multiple Thread Dumps' at top looks nice and is not easily missed as in the JIRA version where its hidden further down the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61621].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61621].

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA relies on Microsoft SQL Server to have the configuration 'READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT'. This trips up many customers as it's not an out-of-the-box configuration for a SQL Server. This is currently documented in the [Connecting to SQL Server Config Guides|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2014-808761244.html]

Without this value, there are parts of JIRA that deadlock, which results in a poor experience for our customers. With the deadlock, the JIRA instance hangs/crashes, typically with a high number of active database connections.  

h3. Environment
JIRA + Microsoft SQL Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Various bugs and Documentation request on this such as: 
- [JRA-60928|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60928]
- [JRA-27019|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27019] 
- [JRA-23622|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23622]


And KB: [Deadlocks During Operation with MS-SQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocks-during-operation-with-ms-sql-264045011.html]


h3. Expected Results
- JIRA Should warn the customer of this requirement at some point in the event it is not correctly configured and is a requirement. Making this misconfiguration more obvious will prevent customers from running into a common scenario.
- JIRA could avoid using database transactions in such a way which lead to the requirement to have shared locks on database objects. 


h3. Actual Results
Customers that use Microsoft SQL Server are currently required to enable this configuration due to behaviours in JIRA that result in 'competitive' queries in the database. 

The recommendation to include this in our documentation came from: [JRA-33439|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33439]

Given that other databases have some form of transaction isolation on by default, it's perhaps likely that we want to stick with the current requirement to enable it. For example, Oracle's transaction isolation is read committed data only. 

h3. Workaround
Follow the documentation to set this value as part of setting up the JIRA Database.
fields.summary: Develop approach to handle READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT requirement within JIRA

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, we do have a warning in regards running JIRA through port below 1024 in the documentation [Changing JIRA application TCP Ports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Changing+JIRA+application+TCP+ports] as a Non-Root user. But, any other documentation such as configuring SSL or Apache integration does not have such reminder. This could make the user using the reserved port and run JIRA as a Non-Root user in which it will be rejected.

h3. Suggested Solution:
It would be great if the reminder is included in other documentation as well that relates to the Port or System User changes. E.g.:
- [Running JIRA through SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-802593051.html]
- [Proxying Atlassian Products using Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/proxying-atlassian-server-applications-with-apache-http-server-806032611.html]
fields.summary: Reminder about Linux reserved port (<1024)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61612].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Attach a .eml file to a JIRA issue
# Using IE11, click the attachment link

h3. Expected results
IE11 downloads the .eml file as an attachment.

h3. Actual results
IE11 attempts to display the file inside the browser instead of downloading it.

h3. Notes
The HTTP headers when clicking the link include {{Content-Disposition:inline}}. Chrome ignores this and downloads the file correctly, but IE11 respects the header. Ideally _all_ .eml files should download as files. HTML files are actually sent with {{Content-Disposition:attachment}} even though a browser _could_ display the content inline.
fields.summary: Use Content-Disposition: attachment for .eml files
IssueService create needs sendMail parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61608].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you update the issue type scheme while removing an issue type you can get into a state where there is an option in the optionset that doesn't exist. This database corruption was the cause of JRA-45161. Fixing this would be removing another way to get into this state. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get an instance with an Issue Type Scheme with a set of Issue Types
# Current Option Set: [1, 2, 3], In the UI I change it to [1, 4, 2, 3]. Where these numbers represent Issue Types.
# During this processing, delete one of the Issue Types
# Check the database table optionconfiguration and there could be a possible row with an optionid that no longer exists.
# Until JRA-45161 is fixed this results in NPE in the UI. 

h3. Expected Results
Can create Issues like usual and the database table optionconfiguration should only have valid options.
h3. Actual Results
Cannot create Issues or view workflows because of NPE and the database table optionconfiguration contains invalid options. 

h3. Workaround
This can be fixed by following the workaround in [NullPointerException when creating issue, editing issue, move issue, accessing the Screen tab from the Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/NullPointerException+when+creating+issue,+editing+issue,+move+issue,+accessing+the+Screen+tab+from+the+Project].
fields.summary: Inconsistent database state for Issue Type Scheme on Update and Remove

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attempting to view a report configured for a project that does not exist causes the server to 500. The expected behaviour is to redirect back to the configure report form with an error message (as is the case if you try to view a restricted project as an anonymous user). This shouldn't occur when users navigate to a report through the configure screen, but may occur when users navigate to reports through bookmarks or shared links that go directly to the result.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an Average Age report for an existing project and navigate to the formatted report (substitute Average Age report for any report that has a project picker).
# Manually change the "projectOrFilterId" URL parameter to a project id that does not exist on the instance (e.g projectOrFilterId=project-99999).
 !change-project-id-to-invalid.png|thumbnail!

The user is redirected back to the configure report form with a "project does not exist" error message.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61601].
  {panel}

Using the Add Post Function in a Workflow, when using the Update Issue Field option, the only Fields available for updating are: Assignee, Description, Environment, Priority, Resolution, Summary, Original Estimate, Remaining Estimate, and Time Spent.

In other words, there a lot of other fields that are missing that should be included.

In particular, I'm wanting Issue Type to be included - if at the very least this field could be added would be great.

Thanks
fields.summary: Cannot update any field in Post Function Transistion
